posts.name: Berat Yumak
posts.cooked:
Hi ı am using pi cam v2 and measurement is so wrong. I am giving the camera height, target height and camera pıtch radıans but these 3 values are not real in fact. I am changing these 3 values until my measurement is correct but when ı drive my robot forward or backward the measurement is goes wrong. Any body can help please

posts.name: Matt
posts.cooked: Probably a couple things going on here. My first question is why aren’t you using 3d mode?

posts.name: Berat Yumak
posts.cooked: this code is from photonvision’s example code ı dont now whole photonvision lib

posts.name: Noah Stricker
posts.cooked: You aren’t using the 3d pose estimation of the tag, but instead you are using a pid loop to move until the tag is at the specified pitch.

posts.name: Berat Yumak
posts.cooked: can you give me a example code for how to use 3d pose

posts.name: tyler hedge
posts.cooked:
have you read the docs?

PhotonLib includes a PhotonPoseEstimator class, which allows you to combine the pose data from all tags in view in order to get a field relative pose. The PhotonPoseEstimator class works with one c...

posts.name: Berat Yumak
posts.cooked: yes but i didn’t get anything

posts.name: Noah Stricker
posts.cooked: Getting in Range of the Target - PhotonVision Docs Here is an example that uses the pose estimate of the tag.

link_counts.title: Getting in Range of the Target - PhotonVision Docs

posts.name: tyler hedge
posts.cooked: Elaborate please. Not to be rude but the “robot code interface” portion of the docs is more or less an end to end tutorial. What is piece is missing?

posts.name: Noah Stricker
posts.cooked: My bad, the getCameraToTarget() method is what you are looking for.
